intro: Gama angulata, commonly known as the angular gama, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its angular, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits. Gama angulata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
